item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Postgres as a VectorDB GUI (46 points | 4 comments)
2. Solaar is a Linux manager for many Logitech keyboards, mice, and other devices (305 points | 135 comments)
3. Half My Life with Perl – By Randal Schwartz (58 points | 13 comments)
4. Firenvim – Turn the browser into a Neovim client (23 points | 2 comments)
5. Piccolo OS, a Small Multitasking OS for the Raspberry Pi Pico (45 points | discuss)
6. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (72 points | 10 comments)
7. Exposing the Clearingstelle Urheberrecht Im Internet (CUII) (16 points | discuss)
8. ISO 8583: The language of credit cards (226 points | 34 comments)
9. Cultural Evolution of Cooperation Among LLM Agents (227 points | 112 comments)
10. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (39 points | 1 comment)
11. Automotive Grade Linux Launches New Expert Group Led by Toyota (23 points | 6 comments)
12. Torpedo juice: Legendary, illegal WWII liquor drunk in Alaska and the world (21 points | 7 comments)
13. The RAM Myth (58 points | 19 comments)
14. Launch HN: Innate (YC F24) – Home robots as easy to program as AI agents (124 points | 58 comments)
15. Tiny Black Holes Could Have Left Tunnels Inside Earth's Rocks (6 points | discuss)

19. I Built a Figma Plugin That Generates Custom SVG Illustrations with AI (24 points | 8 comments)

21. There's No Such Thing as Software Productivity (2012) (71 points | 66 comments)
22. Corvus Robotics (YC S18) is hiring a Head of Software to help inventory drones ( | hide)
23. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (261 points | 196 comments)
24. Genesis – a generative physics engine for general-purpose robotics (10 points | 6 comments)
25. Moon (2842 points | 236 comments)
26. Advanced Civilizations Could Be Indistinguishable from Nature (54 points | 26 comments)
27. Formally Modeling Dreidel, the Sequel (84 points | 22 comments)
28. "The Custer Wolf is Dead." (1921) [pdf] (41 points | 7 comments)
29. Java in the Small (215 points | 143 comments)
30. Consider the Shipwreck: Ten Books on Maritime Disasters and Ecological Collapse (14 points | 2 comments)
